JobDescription:
About the job
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain a platform that automates the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, from data ingestion to model deployment and monitoring
Implement best practices for code quality, testing, version control, and documentation
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to model performance, reliability, and security
Optimize model training and inference pipelines for speed, efficiency, and scalability
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and cloud platform engineers to integrate machine learning models into existing systems and applications

Experience with cloud platforms and services providers, preferably Azure and Google Cloud Platform
Experience with Azure AI services

Title: Senior BI Developer
CompanyDetails: Tata Consultancy Services · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 3 weeks ago · 29 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
1. JOB PURPOSE: 

To identify business intelligence, reporting and data analysis needs of the client. To design, develop, implement and ensure proper maintenance of medium-to-large scale Business Intelligence (BI) applications built using Power BI software. 
  2. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 
  Works as an individual or as part of a team in identifying business intelligence, reporting and data analysis (advanced analytics/statistical analysis) needs of the client. Designs data models for medium-to-large applications in full or in part as assigned. Takes charge in the preparation of the data model and ETL requirements and design. Develops corporate and adhoc reports. 
 Ensures that the assigned data models and/or components (data mart and data stores/warehouse and Bi application) are designed to meet customer needs. Provides data that is accurate, reliable, and ensures that the information is easily available to the client for direct consumption, or integration with other systems. 
 Ensures that the system is accurately coded and tested in accordance with requirements and design documents; and fully documented in accordance with ADB’s standards and methods. Provides documentation that is clear and easy to understand. 
 Trains clients in using the corporate reports. And educates them on how to use the data available to display information in different forms for the purpose of their own analysis. 
 Works with staff, consultants and outsourcing contractors who may be involved in the development/ maintenance of assigned application systems. 
 Works with OIST ITD technical support staff to ensure assigned systems are properly operated and maintained. 
 Regularly submits reports on progress status including problems encountered and resource requirements of assigned application systems 
  3. CORE COMPETENCIES: 
  Technical Knowledge and Skills 
 - Able to help and advise others based on their specialist area of knowledge and skill 
 - Uses technical knowledge and skills to complete complex work 
 - Uses technical knowledge and skills to improve work systems 
  Client Orientation 
 - Works to meet the needs of clients according to ADB policy 
 - Communicates often with clients and seeks to understand and anticipate their needs 
 - Works with clients to find ways to meet changing needs 
  Achieving Results 
 - Finds ways to reduce time and cost of completing work 
 - Works with others to overcome problems and find alternative ways to complete work when necessary 
  Working Together 
- Works with other members of the team as needed to complete assigned work 
  Learning and Knowledge Sharing 
 - Learns new skills and knowledge and applies them 
 - Continuously finds new solutions to problems 
 - Shares knowledge and expertise with the team 
  4. Education Requirements: 
  Bachelor's degree in Computer/Software Engineering, MIS, Computer Science, or related areas. 
    5. Relevant Experience and Other Requirements: 
  At least 5 years' experience in modeling data, ETL analysis and design, including comprehensive experience in SQL programming. 
 Proficiency in SQL programming, Oracle RDBMS, creating data models using Cognos Framework Manager, creating ETL scripts and jobs using Cognos Data Manager or similar BI tool; creating reports and analytics using Cognos Report/Analysis/Query/Metric Studios or similar BI tool. 
 Proficiency in SQL performance analysis and tuning. 
 Excellent oral and written communications skills. 
 Excellent ability in systems analysis and design, and in the preparation of functional and detailed specifications documents. 
 Extensive knowledge in analysis, design, development and implementation of BI systems using standards- and best practices-based methodologies and frameworks and in the use of associated productivity tools. 
 Good interpersonal, communication and writing skills, and ability to promote team work.

Title: Cyber Transformation Senior Engineer (IAM)
CompanyDetails: KPMG Philippines · Makati, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago · 10 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Responsibilities
Design, plan, develop, and implement IAM solutions based on the organization's security and compliance requirements. Develop custom applications, connectors, and integrations to support IAM workflows and functionalities.
Configure and maintain identity and access management systems, such as IAM platforms, Single Sign-On (SSO) solutions, and Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) systems.
Manage the entire user lifecycle, including provisioning, deprovisioning, and role changes, ensuring that access permissions are appropriate and timely. Implement automation to streamline user onboarding and offboarding processes.
Define and enforce access control policies, including role-based access control (RBAC) and attribute-based access control (ABAC). Regularly review and update access policies to align with changing business needs and security requirements.
Implement and maintain authentication mechanisms, such as LDAP, OAuth, SAML, and Kerberos. Ensure that authorization mechanisms are robust, accurate, and compliant with industry regulations.
Monitor IAM systems for security vulnerabilities and promptly address any identified issues. Maintain compliance with relevant data protection regulations, industry standards, and internal policies.
Actively participate in incident response activities related to identity and access management breaches or incidents.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of IAM processes, configurations, and policies. Generate regular reports and metrics related to user access, compliance, and system performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and compliance teams, to align IAM strategies with organizational goals. Work with vendors and third-party providers to evaluate and integrate IAM solutions.
Stay up-to-date with emerging IAM technologies, best practices, and industry trends. Continuously improve IAM processes and systems to enhance security and efficiency.
Facilitate knowledge transfer on IAM solution and/or IAM security best practices

Qualifications (Key Skills/Experience)
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in IAM and IT security, including experience with IAM technologies such as Saviynt (REQUIRED), ForgeRock (preferred), SailPoint and Ping.
Strong understanding of IAM best practices, security and compliance requirements, and experience with other IAM technologies such as Azure, Active Directory, Single Sign-On, PAM, and Multi-Factor authentication (MFA)
Experience with implementing and maintaining IAM/IGA solutions and infrastructure.
Experience with administration/management of IAM/IGA solutions for provisioning/deprovisioning of accounts, integration of applications and creation of workflows
Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and mitigate security risks.
Excellent communication and project management skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams.
Specific 1 year ‘experience in consulting/advisory engagements and pre-sales of IAM/IGA solutions (preferred)
Understanding of Cloud Compute, Storage, Security and Virtualization best practice
Strong time management skills which allow for multi-tasking while managing shifting priorities
Experience in programming languages such as Java, HTML, SQL, Python, JavaScript, JSON and XML
Preferably has at least one of the following certifications:
Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM)
Certifications on SailPoint solutions/products
Certifications on Saviynt solutions/products
Certifications on CyberArk solutions/products

Title: Site Reliability Engineer
CompanyDetails: Nasdaq · Taguig, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago · 16 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Nasdaq has been a technology leader throughout its fifty-year tenure, developing the market infrastructure that underpins its global exchanges. Currently, 130+ marketplaces around the world leverage Nasdaq’s technology. Our technology can support multiple types of marketplaces including traditional capital markets, as well as new marketplaces such as cryptocurrency, real estate, carbon credits, and more.

We now seek a highly motivated System Reliability Engineer to join our technical operations team, to further grow our presence in the Asia-Pacific region. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a dynamic work environment.

What We Do

Nasdaq has a long history of delivering and running marketplaces on behalf of our clients “as-a-Service”. Our team is responsible for keeping these systems up and running. We take advantage of the power of cloud computing to scale - we also rely on traditional on-premises systems to cater to our client's needs.

We are a geographically distributed team working from five countries across North America, Europe, and Asia. This enables us to apply a follow-the-sun support model to improve work-life balance.

If you are a proactive self-starter with a passion for technology and have the interest to learn more about the financial industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Skills And Requirements

You can expect an autonomous but fast-paced work environment where you are recognized for your results and ability to drive things forward. Every day brings many opportunities to learn & grow and rewards with a global impact we create.

We will teach you Nasdaq’s in-house developed software and the way we work, but to make a good fit we believe the below resonates well with you:

Feel comfortable navigating and managing Linux and Kubernetes systems
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab CI or other automation tools.
Design, build and support highly available and scalable cloud-based systems in AWS and/or Azure, as well as to implement them with Terraform.
Solid understating of Python, Perl, Bash, or any other scripting language.
Familiar with internet protocols and distributed systems.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Excellent team player with ability to work collaboratively with colleagues of varying levels of experience.
Strong communication skills and ability to document technical solutions.
Participate in our teams on-call rotation to provide support for our systems during special occasions and weekends.

Benefits

This is a permanent full-time role based in Bonifacio Global City, Taguig following a hybrid work arrangement and an APAC day-shift schedule.

Among the benefits you will receive are a great compensation package, HMO coverage for you and your dependents, annual bonus, employee stock purchase plan, retirement plan, mentorship, wellness subscription plans, paid vacation and paid sick leave.

Come as You Are

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Solutions Engineer CPaaS
CompanyDetails: 8x8 · Philippines 1 week ago · 14 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
At 8x8 Inc. [Nasdaq:EGHT] we put communications at the heart of our business and build technology that allows people to connect anytime, anywhere they are in the world, and on any device. XCaaS - the 8x8 Experience Communications Platform - brings together Employee and Customer Experience, enabling hybrid workforces across the globe to connect, collaborate, and delight customers, while providing businesses with real-time communications analytics, intelligence and unique insights.

Learn more on our company website at www.8x8.com follow our pages on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solution Engineer to join our growing CPaaS Solution Engineering team based in the Philippines. You will have a customer-obsessed vision and a passion for wanting to understand our customer's problem(s). You should be contextually aware and able to bridge the gap between business and technology whilst working alongside our sales team and helping our customers get the most out of 8x8 solutions and technology.

To be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate hands-on experience in consultative selling of a CPaaS product set, have a strong technical understanding of customer environments and a good background in supporting customers directly.

Being a strong team player is essential.

This role is a perfect opportunity for an ambitious and autonomous personality who enjoys challenges, loves technology and engaging with people and aims for success.

As a Solutions Engineer at 8x8, your responsibilities will include:

 Work with the sales team and be the technical point of contact throughout the sales cycle for internal and external parties, participating in discovery calls, running and creating customised demonstrations, understanding and providing solutions to customers’ challenges, and being a thought leader and trusted advisor while building solid relationships with prospects.
Management of PoC and trials, working closely with the prospect to ensure their challenges are defined and met.
Take full ownership and accountability of all technical sales processes.
Provide direct support for the functional and technical fulfilment of RFIs, RFQs, and RFPs. 
Communicate directly with customers, perform client visits for presentations and training workshops, and attend trade shows & conferences on occasion.
Stay up to date with competitors’ products and identify current and future customer service requirements to provide valuable feedback and input to the product team.
Maintain detailed engagement notes and documents and share your experiences and learnings with team members.

Desired Skills And Experiences

Minimum 8 years of Sales Engineering or Solution Engineering experience in the mobile and/or telecom industry. Minimum in APAC, Global desirable. 
Ability to provide technical leadership to the sales team with a strong sense of responsibility, initiative and commitment.
A strong team player with the ability to work remotely effectively.
Experience and knowledge of the mobile & telecom industry and associated technologies, preferably including; SMS, ChatApps (WhatsApp, Viber, WeChat etc.), Voice, Video, APIs & Application Integration & Network Architecture.
Pre-sales consulting experience and technical know-how to understand complex solutions.
A proactive problem solver, willing to listen and with a desire to continually and autonomously learn and adapt to change.
Proven time management skills in a dynamic sales environment.
Strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills with an ability to influence audiences internally and externally.
Creativity and understanding to design, create and deliver product demonstrations using the 8x8 CpaaS product set.
Credible in representing the company to customers and other stakeholders.
A high achiever with initiative and enthusiasm, good attention to detail and an interest and aptitude in technology.
You want to be part of a high-growth and high-performing team that will go the extra mile to help our customers and get deals closed.
Written and Verbal fluency in English is required.

Title: Associate Data Engineer
CompanyDetails: TaskUs · Pasig, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago · 108 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
So what does an Associate Data Engineer do? Think of yourself as someone who is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, data warehouses for use by the analytics infrastructure, so not just anyone is qualified for this role! We make sure we get the best of the best, after all, we are a ridiculously good company so we make sure our employees are top notch. So come on, now we need your full concentration because it’s time to imagine what it’s like being an Associate Data Engineer.

Imagine yourself going to work with one thing on your mind: you will assist in making accurate and meaningful data available for consumption of TaskUs Business Intelligence reporting methodology. As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it will lead to one thing: that everything you do is in order to meet an enterprise’s data delivery, business analysis and reporting needs.

As an Associate Data Engineer, you will:

Configure
Configures and sets up solutions based on pre-approved patterns to move data from operational and external environments to the business intelligence environment.
Management of data integration & ETL jobs – consolidation, aggregation, filtering, validation, data quality routines, dimension creation, etc.
Configure and Deploy automation of jobs based on pre-approved and reusable patterns framework. Executes production-level jobs by considering data dependencies, schedules, validation routines, data stream updates.
Design, develop and verify the data model according to the business requirements, and continuously optimize the model.

Collaborate with technical users to define data requirements & establish business rules to be applied
Collaborate with key business stakeholders to deliver and continually enhance the BI platform to provide relevant and accurate insights through the delivery of new datasets

Test
Validate and verify the data model according to the business requirements, and continuously optimize the model.
Performs unit and system integration testing, on development projects.
Undertaking peer reviews, assisting with testing, and ensuring documentation is up to date.

Monitor
Monitor Error Handling and Logging tools and processes. Troubleshoot configuration and data errors.
Monitor Performance and raise appropriate flags.
Identify opportunities to optimize the ETL environment, implement monitoring, quality and validation processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Do you have what it takes to become an Associate Data Engineer?

Requirements:
Has at least 3 years of data integration experience using any programming languages (SQL, SAS or Python) to produce data marts, mappings, table relationships, and reports. 
Other programming languages related to SQL/data management can also be considered. 
Deep knowledge in creating database objects such as views (normal, materialized), stored procedures, schema, and tables (external, normal).

Learn more about our team and company story here. 

What is the purpose of this role in the delivery of our mission?

Implement, and maintain highly available infrastructure on AWS, working closely with the Dev, QA, and IT teams to deliver large-scale systems using CI/CD pipelines. Stay on top of technology trends and develop expertise in emerging cloud technologies.

Several demonstrable years of experience in a DevOps role.

Title: Software Architect | Permanent WFH | Day Shift + Weekends Off | Day 1 HMO
CompanyDetails: Emapta Global · Philippines Reposted 1 week ago · 90 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Join Our Client in Revolutionizing Healthcare Technology with this International Role

Are you a Software Architect ready to make a profound impact on the global stage and leave a lasting legacy that transcends borders? Join our client’s dynamic team in the healthcare technology industry and be part of a journey that goes beyond geographical limits. In this role, you'll shape the future of healthcare by crafting cutting-edge solutions that touch lives worldwide. Enjoy the perks of working with a passionate team, competitive benefits, and the opportunity to make your mark in a field where innovation knows no bounds. Take your career to new heights and be a part of something truly extraordinary.

Job Description 

We are seeking a talented and experienced Software Architect to lead our client’s software development projects. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions that align with the company’s strategic business objectives. As a Software Architect, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that our client’s software systems are scalable, maintainable, and deliver exceptional value to customers.

Here’s an overview of your future role:
Employment type: Full-time
Shift: Day Shift
Work Setup: Permanent Work from Home
Perks: Day 1 HMO, Above-market salary, Global exposure

What do you need to succeed?  

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Software Architect or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful software projects.
In-depth knowledge of software development methodologies, design patterns, and best practices.
Proficiency in programming languages, frameworks, and tools relevant to the company's tech stack (AWS, PHP, Angular, MySQL)
Strong communication and leadership skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team and explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms
Understanding of database design and data modeling.
Knowledge of security principles and practices.
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.

What awaits you in this role?  

Create and maintain the overall software architecture that meets both current and future business needs, considering scalability, performance, security, and maintainability.
Provide technical leadership to development teams, mentor software engineers, and establish best practices for software development.
Collaborate with other teams to ensure seamless integration of software components, third-party APIs, and external services.
Develop prototypes and proofs of concept to evaluate the feasibility of new technologies or architectural designs.
Implement and enforce quality assurance processes to ensure the software meets high standards of reliability and quality.
Conduct code reviews to maintain coding standards and ensure the implementation aligns with the architectural design.
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and optimize software for maximum efficiency.
Create and maintain architectural documentation, including design specifications, diagrams, and technical documentation.
Ensure that security is integrated into the architecture and stay current on industry best practices and security standards.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends and make recommendations for technology adoption.

Why choose us?  

Above-average industry-standard compensation package
Permanent WFH set-up
Day shift schedule
Day 1 HMO
20 Leave credits per year consumed at your discretion with up to 5 days commutable to cash
Exposure to world-class, high-level management from foreign direct superiors
Employee engagement activities

Whom you’ll work with:  

Our client, Abroad Source, is at the forefront of revolutionizing the care management industry with their cloud-based software platform. This innovative company offers a unique opportunity to join a team dedicated to transforming the way the world delivers care, health, and support services. At Abroad Source, they are making a significant impact by enhancing the lives of older individuals with disabilities and fostering connections with their loved ones. This role presents a chance to contribute to a mission-driven organization that is making a difference on a global scale.

Who are we? 

Discover a world of possibilities at Emapta, where your career takes flight in stability and growth. Join a team that thrives on camaraderie, supporting each other to achieve excellence together. Experience the satisfaction of being recognized for your contributions with competitive compensation packages that reflect your skills and commitment. Immerse yourself in a positive work culture that encourages collaboration, innovation, and personal development. We provide you with the platform for your success, empowering you to reach new heights in a supportive and inclusive environment. 

With a wide roster of international clients from various industries and a proven track record of success, Emapta offers a stable foundation for your career. Team up with like-minded professionals who are passionate about making a meaningful impact through premium global opportunities at your fingertips. Apply now and create a better future with us. 

#EmaptaExperience

Title: Systems Engineer - Access Management
CompanyDetails: Canva · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines Reposted 1 day ago · 154 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
What You’d Be Doing In This Role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

About The Group

The Information Technology Group’s vision is to maximize the potential of every Canvanaut through world-class technology & service. This is a pivotal group at Canva where you will be on the ground of a rapidly growing team as we strive to radically innovate the foundational infrastructure of our access management technology.

About The Team

The Access Management team supports the evaluation, implementation, administration, and ongoing innovation of Access Management technologies to support Canva’s growth

We use Okta as our primary IdP, and with the scale of our organization, we’re constantly integrating new technology and applications.

This includes SaaS onboarding & offboarding, entitlement propagation, supporting flexible employment patterns, application integration & access management, and more!

We’re looking for someone to help continue investing in scalable identity & access systems and beyond.

We're on the hunt for an awesome Systems Engineer to join our team! As a Systems Engineer in the Access Management team, you'll be responsible for empowering our Canvanauts through the delivery of our Access Management services.

What This Role Will Be Doing

 First point of contact for Access Management Tickets raised in our IT Service Desk 
 Implementing Access Management Controls on new and existing Third-Party SaaS systems (SSO, Authentication, Authorisation, Role-Based Access, Identity Lifecycle, User Access review) 
 Make Complex Things Simple by automating existing and new business processes using Integration Platform as a Service tools (iPaaS) 
 Providing consulting services & support related to Access Management for various types of requests, changes, escalations, and incidents. 
 Write clear and comprehensive documentation, as well as a willingness to share their knowledge with the team. 


Required Experience

 Outstanding communication skills 
 Ability to manage multiple, competing tasks & priorities with ease 
 Experience in Identity Lifecycle Management, Authentication, Access Control, Authorisation and Access Requests 
 Experience configuring identity and Access Management (IAM) tools, i.e. SSO and MFA 
 Technical knowledge of app integration protocols such as SCIM, SAML, and OIDC 


 What's in it for you? 

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a Taste Of What's On Offer

 Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too 
 Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers 
 An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more 
 Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally 


Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other Stuff To Know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Join The Team Redefining How The World Experiences Design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where And How You Can Work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney, Australia, but with many of our Canvanauts calling the Philippines home, our office in Manila is a buzzing place. Whether your role needs you in the office, at home or a bit of both, we've created an environment that truly empowers you to thrive.

Title: Software Engineer

JobDescription:
About the job
Who we are
Champ Cargosystems is building systems that power the business of cargo airlines all over the world providing solutions for the whole cargo management chain including reservation and booking management, revenue, handling & customs declaration and balancing the weight of the cargo inside the plane.
 
What we do
We are currently in the process of building the next generation of cargo management applications using modern and widely use technologies and we are looking for motivated people to join our team of interdisciplinary developers.
 
What we currently use
We build backend services with Java, Spring Boot, Web Services and Oracle / SQL Server / Mongo DB
We integrate with existing core Java Cargo applications via REST APIs
We build frontends with Angular and Ionic framework for mobile apps
We deploy to Linux servers, Windows servers, and AWS with ansible/ANT
We do continuous integration with Gitlab/Bamboo
We use Scrum to organize ourselves
 

What we expect from you
Perform several roles such as program coder, tester and technical support
Collaborate with other software engineers in the performance of assigned tasks.
Translate design specifications into program codes; enforce the Company’s software engineering methodology and standards.
Champion good code quality practices towards reliable, performant and maintainable solutions
Participate in the technical discussions on project updates/ in resolving technical issues.
Produce clean, efficient code based on specifications.
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing software.
Participate in the unit tests and to provide support during system implementation/ migration activities.
Assist in the preparation of project documentation.


What we require from you
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Equivalent
Must have 3 years’ experience in Java & object-oriented programming with SQL skills 
Experience in the following framework or technology is a plus Spring Boot, JPA, REST API, XML, Swing, RMI, Hibernate, EJB, Angular, Ionic, IBM MQ, Kafka 
Experienced in using the following tools: SVN, Tortoise, Eclipse, Maven or Ant or similar
With good SQL skills on databases (Oracle, SQL Server)
Experience in SCRUM and DevOps practices is a plus
Knowledgeable in design pattern is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Good command of English language is a must
 
What you can expect from us
Working environment, learning tools and opportunities to grow your technical and professional career
The possibility to have an impact on the direction to take
Technical challenges to solve
The opportunity to work within an interesting industry
To work with people from many different countries
